#Text=Wikinews interviews Mike Lebowitz , Chairman of the Modern Whig Party
#Text=Monday , October 13 , 2008
#Text=In the United States , there are two major political parties ; the Republican and the Democratic .
#Text=However , there are several other minor - commonly referred to as " third " - parties .

column1: #Text=One of these is the Modern Whig Party , which has been steadily increasing in popularity over recent months .
#Text=Last week , Wikinews reporter Joseph Ford was able to speak with MWP Chairman Mike Lebowitz about how his party was formed , what it stands for , and why you should consider joining .
#Text=The interview can be read below .
#Text=Interview
#Text=Wikinews ( Joseph Ford ) : What does The Modern Whig Party stand for ?
#Text=The Modern Whig Party is unique in that it minimizes traditional ideology and instead stands for common sense solutions and rational thought .

#Text=In fact , this grassroots movement is a non-fringe , mainstream effort designed to cater to those individuals who find themselves cherry-picking between traditional Republican ideals and also traditional Democratic ideals .
#Text=The fact remains that most people agree with various aspects of both major parties , but one or two issues or reasons ultimately compels them to identify with a specific political party .
#Text=The Modern Whig Party offers a home for these independent-minded individuals .
#Text=The general platform of the Modern Whig Party relates to fiscal responsibility , strong national defense and bold social progression .
#Text=How old is your party ?
#Text=How many members does it currently have ?
#Text=The age of the party depends on how one views our organization .
#Text=The " Whig " name has been associated with American history and tradition since the early 19th Century .

column1: #Text=The old Whig Party was mainstream and middle-of-the-road during its time .
#Text=It are those general aspects of rational thinking and common sense that we adopt in terms of the old Whig Party .
#Text=But at the same time , we do stress that we are the " Modern " Whig Party .
#Text=We recognize that we live in a different time .
#Text=In that regard , the Modern Whig Party basic infrastructure was organized in 2007 , and ultimately went public in April 2008 .
#Text=Currently , the Modern Whig Party has well over 10,000 members .

#Text=We realize this is a modest number in the grand scheme of things , but considering how quickly we have inspired these members to sign on offers evidence that this movement has a chance to catch on and grow .

#Text=The Modern Whig Party was originally founded by Iraq/Afghanistan veterans as a veterans ' advocacy organization and our growth has occurred with minimal funding and can be regarded as a truly grassroots effort .
#Text=It also is important to note that roughly 6,500 of these members are affiliated with the military .
#Text=Our membership expanded so quickly based almost exclusively on word-of-mouth through the military ranks .
#Text=Instead of trying to attract people to our Web site , we decided to come to them .
#Text=What happened was that military members would send emails to their friends , who in turn would forward these emails to others .
#Text=These emails described our movement and provided a means of merely contacting the national party , providing some basic information and ultimately becoming a member .

#Text=Word of mouth among the military eventually caught the Pentagon 's attention due to the fact that the military is supposed to be apolitical , and the Modern Whig Party was ultimately featured in the Military Times newspapers .
#Text=We have since expanded with members coming from all walks of life -- military and non-military alike .
